headings: New Dean Appointed for ASU’s Archer College of Health and Human Services
ASU Announces Fall Commencement Ceremonies Schedule
ASU Announces Phi Kappa Phi Honor Society Fall 2024 Inductees
ASU Announces Alpha Chi Honor Society Fall 2024 Inductees
Teacher Education Prof Joins Leadership of State Agency
Political Science Students Win Awards at National Conference
History Professor Selected for Prestigious Overseas Seminar
ASU Earns Multiple National Honors for Veteran/Military Education
Buche Named Angelo State’s 2024 Veteran of the Year
Agriculture Prof, Students & Alumni Shine at TSSRM Conference
paragraphs: December 19, 2024

Dr. Katie Lyman, previously the dean of health occupations and healthcare simulation at Kirkwood Community College in Cedar Rapids, Iowa, has been appointed as the dean of Angelo State University’s Archer College of Health and Human Services, effective April 1, 2025.
December 10, 2024
Nearly 750 Angelo State University students are scheduled to walk the stage during two fall commencement ceremonies on Saturday, Dec. 14, in the Junell Center/Stephens Arena, 2235 S. Jackson St.
December 9, 2024

Angelo State University’s chapter of the Phi Kappa Phi (PKP) national honor society recently inducted its fall 2024 class of 62 new student members during a special initiation ceremony in the Houston Harte University Center.
December 2, 2024

Angelo State University’s chapter of the Alpha Chi national collegiate honor society recently inducted 32 new members for the fall 2024 semester during a ceremony in the Houston Harte University Center.
November 25, 2024

Dr. Carlos Flores Jr., an associate professor in Angelo State University’s Department of Teacher Education, has been elected secretary of the Texas Association of Teacher Educators (TxATE) and is serving a one-year term.
November 22, 2024

Two Angelo State University political science students earned individual awards for their performances at the recent 28th annual Eugene Scassa Mock Organization of American States (ESMOAS) Collegiate Summit of the Americas Conference at Baylor University.
November 19, 2024

Dr. Rebekah McMillan of the Angelo State University history faculty has been selected for a 2025 Overseas Faculty Development Seminar by the Council for American Overseas Research Center (CAORC) and will spend about three weeks in India in January.
November 13, 2024

Angelo State University has again earned national recognition from several organizations for excellence in education and related services that significantly contribute to the academic success of veteran and military students and their families.
November 8, 2024

In commemoration of Veterans Day, Angelo State University has named Dr. William Buche, a retired San Angelo oral surgeon and veteran of both the U.S. Air Force and U.S. Army, the 2024 ASU Veteran of the Year.
October 31, 2024

Dr. Cody Scott, an Angelo State University alum and professor in the ASU Department of Agriculture, received the 2024 Outstanding Contribution to Rangeland Management Award at the recent annual meeting of the Texas Section, Society for Range Management (TSSRM) in Victoria.
